txt.en: Bring a bucket of water to the tired donkey
You have given the donkey some refreshing water. Next, you should find some fresh straw and give him something to eat. There is a stack of donkey feed on the north-west side of Western Khanâg.
Bring fresh straw to the tired donkey
Tell the donkey that he is very handsome
You have done everything you can think of to fulfil the donkey's needs. You should talk to his owner, Bangud, in Western Khanâg.
Water seems to be the donkey's most immediate need. There is a bucket of water near the north-eastern fountain in Western Khanâg.
You have watered and fed the tired donkey. Next, you should brush the dust from his coat.
'I thank you for your help, stranger. He looks much happier now. Telling him that he is handsome was a good touch.'
You have watered, fed, and groomed the tired donkey. Donkeys are social animals. Perhaps you should also talk to him and give him a compliment?
Bring the rusty swords to Sigênik in Khanâg
Bangud, a traveller resting in Western Khanâg, has injured his back and is unable to tend to his tired donkey.

'Excuse me stranger, have you a moment to spare? I have thrown out my back and I am unable to care for my donkey. We have just returned from a long journey and the poor animal needs tending to, but I am unable to do it.\n\n'Do you have a moment to help? He needs fresh food, water, and the dust brushed from his coat.'
The Making of a Happy Donkey
